66OjgLjIxL0xvmksxZuVUA.text: When you're hopping off the bus in Bloomfield, it's late at night, and you have that powerful sushi craving...there's Ginza. I love that they offer a tasty hand-roll, sushi or sashimi. Their fish is cut properly, and most importantly is fresh. No, it's not as good as Penn Ave Fish Company, but it's much better than several other Pittsburgh sushi experiences I could name. The price is right too - I recently got 2 salmon handrails to go for less than $11. Everyone there is very friendly, and there is always a table available, even when you walk in. They are willing to make modifications within reason too. I absolutely love pickled ginger, and they were happy to send me on my way with extra. Overall, a great experience, and a consistent positive experience.

EoYK52skBcG3T19__aDGpQ.text: Ginza has, by far, the BEST sushi in the Pittsburgh area. The quality of the fish is excellent; no "fishy" taste. I ordered (take-out) the Aloha Roll, the Naruto Roll, and the Alaska Roll and all three were delish! The host was especially helpful as I chose which rolls to order; he asked what I liked/didn't like and made recommendations based off of my input. They have a large selection of sushi to choose from as well which I really liked. The prices for the rolls are pretty comparable to other sushi restaurants, and ranged from ~$5 to ~$17 depending on the ingredients included in the roll. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Aloha Roll
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Alaska Roll (top) and Naruto Roll (bottom)

LQ8QyM5BAyOfw4IhSzGwYg.text: Really good fresh sushi with a nice variety.  Great service too. This is our go to sushi restaurant now.

2jLRJyWmUI12isS4W7lEuQ.text: My boyfriend and I each ordered a hibachi dinner meal, and wow, what a deal! We each asked for miso soup, instead of the clear soup that is included, at no extra cost. The miso was VERY strong/thick, but tasty. Our meals also included a small salad, which my boyfriend got with the original gingery dressing, but I omitted, since it contains dairy. The waitress kindly brought over some oil instead. The main courses were HUGE, and my vegetable hibachi was very delicious. You have your choice of fried rice or white, so I ordered fried without egg. I was stuffed, and still took some veggies home, AND my meal cost only 10 bucks (my boyfriend's steak hibachi was 15).  The atmosphere, service, and quality of food all receive A's from me. From now on, I will be coming here instead of Nakama for hibachi. And thank you for being so vegan-aware, and able to accommodate!  ***EDIT: I had to change from five stars to three, due to my recent return visit:  I had the same waitress as last time, but this time she checked with the chef about the hibachi to make sure it was vegan. She returned with sad news: the veggies are prepared with a pork base! Apparently, the only vegan entree option is to order the mango chicken with tofu instead. It was very tasty, but a bit pricey and not nearly as awesome as the hibachi. I still appreciate that the waitress took my vegan concerns into consideration, but I hope Ginza expands their menu to include more vegan-friendly options so that I may go back!

YNJr98HP0KUIhhxdfIZNbQ.text: Disappointed by lack of hibachi noodles and the rest of the food wasn't impressive. But the service was great!!

O6GOZxKOop6IiHUcgX5GJA.text: Clean and with friendly service. Large menu which unfortunately includes mayo on the overwhelming majority of sushi is a huge miss for me which makes this barely 3 stars.  Also, their recipe for teriyaki tofu and vegetables:  10% broccoli, 20% tofu, 15% green peppers, and 55% sliced onions in a wonderful house-made sauce. No carrots, zucchini, or mushrooms. Odd.

mTSa3mgv-VDI-gEMyOcXiw.text: Had the sushi sashimi bento ... The fish was on Pointe. I would recommend any sashimi lovers to come here for their fish, which was the perfect consistency. Great bargain for the quality and great service.

0UXFryNfMNg4LwPnYq2qAg.text: Quick attentive service and good food. Byob though, so remember your beer/wine, if you want a drink.

kHXiwL5DvMDGX86UKDr8Gw.text: I am new to Pittsburgh and have been looking for good eat spots. I was pretty impressed with all of their food, we had both sushi and hibachi style entrees and all of it was delicious!

bJ9IyDQZOhh6MjOjryPbdw.text: This is a very casual restaurant with nice food  We all ordered different dishes and all were good  As in this area only problem is parking  The prices are fair and the service is pretty good and kind  They try to be accommodating to your request  It was my daughter Bday and they brought dessert with a candle;) that was a nice touch  Fried ice cream desert is deli!  Good place we would be back ;))

SNmPfKNQHcMLa0i_GdaN4Q.text: Came here for the sushi and it was AWESOME. It's now my new best sushi in Pittsburgh. There were so many unique rolls, loaded with ingredients and reasonably priced. We came on a Saturday night and didn't need a reservation or anything. Best meal I've had in a long time!!

ZzSr1xIXScDy8Th3GRrYpw.text: The sushi was fine - the seaweed on the wraps was a bit tough/chewy but overall it's decent sushi if not slightly overpriced for the quality. However the biggest issue was with the service - it was rushed at times and slow at others. The waiter repeatedly commented how much sushi we got (3 special rolls and 1 small roll) between two people and also commented on how much we ate of it. He made both of us very uncomfortable. Fine place to get sushi if you're in a rush but avoid if possible.

d0Gkt6GmWbdv1duJhbd-8g.text: Ginza is a good deal, especially if you're looking for some quick, cheap sushi as well as a few nice hibachi options. The service is great, and the place is clean and altogether not bad-looking on the inside. I've gone here for lunch to catch up with friends and we didn't feel pressured to leave the second we were finished our meal or anything, which was very nice. I do wish some of the entrees were less bland, but you can't have everything. Perhaps it's because I prefer a little bit more spice, but the hibachi chicken and salmon dishes I've tried were rather underwhelming. The fish used in the sashimi and sushi seems fresh for the most part though, and since it's raw that's far more important to me!

3EMlFbH4MoliHN8Fg85fCg.text: This place still has consistently good sushi! I have moved neighborhoods now and tried a bunch of other places, but it's still my favorite in the city. I wish they had delivery!

5WeG9Vv-CH68oTy0PlvFjQ.text: Service was slow and weird.  We had a couple waiters and they weren't coordinating with one another. The hibachi rice had an off putting taste and the rolls were what you'd expect as part of a lunch special. Won't be back

Hsg_RjgoSUHhxuFJs0SQZA.text: Beware! I am pretty sure that they are serving fake tuna. It certainly has the deep red color as real tuna but it definitely does not have the taste or texture of real tuna. I am also skeptical of the fish that was supposed to be salmon (or whatever the orange one is supposed to be). The shrimp seemed okay.   We got the $50 "Love Boat". It definitely wasn't worth it.

4D4Bz6ANudTPFFH43S1QHA.text: We decided to try Ginza one random night for sushi as we were looking for some new places to try.  We ended up ordering the Ginza Mountain and a Ginza roll. The Mountain was HUGE! Tons of fish in there. Everything seems pretty fresh to us, which is probably the most important factor with sushi. It was all pretty good, however, a lot of the menu includes tempura including the Spicy Yellowtail and Ginza roll. I have to say I'm not a big fan of that. If I want tempura, I'll get tempura separately. Otherwise the food was decent if not particularly inspired.  A couple of items to note:  This is a BYOB establishment, so plan accordingly (we didn't unfortunately). Interestingly, their spicy was not particularly spicy. I'm used to more spice than this, which was a little disappointing.   Overall this was a pretty good deal for sushi, so if money is a major factor, this is certainly a place to consider. However, I think there are other better places for sushi in the city.

9S69ByD2NUlcFDF0TQePyg.text: Admittedly, my knowledge of sushi restaurants is very limited, but this place is a gem, no lie.   The sushi itself was excellent, The preparation wasn't quite as extravagant as some other people have experienced here, but I don't grade on flair, I grade on quality. The service wasn't nearly as bad as some reviews would have you think; it was on par with any other restaurant and we were treated well throughout.   I'll admit I was a little worried when I initially went in because it seemed a little TOO quiet, but then business started to pick up as the night went on.   We got the Ginza Roll, a Tuna Roll or some such, and a Sweet Potato Roll.   If you don't get the Sweet Potato roll, you are wrong. I am unabashedly judging you from the internet if you don't partake of the Ginza sweet potato roll. I don't care if you don't like sweet potato. It doesn't matter. Broaden your horizons and get one because it will blow your mind.   And then, the price! I don't know how they do it, but then again, who cares? I walked out of there for only like $32, and that would have been easily twice that any most other sushi places for the amount of food that we got at that level of quality.

xBJQkUyKJkeHBp8iC7w4yw.text: Ginza is just what other reviewers say, delicious sushi at a price that will not make you feel guilty when the tiny rolls come out. I was skeptical when I saw the menu prices, thinking "What's the catch?"But, Ginza is the real deal, good sushi at an even better price.  I've gone for both lunch and dinner, and this place has some of the best sushi deals in town. For dinner, I recommend going with a friend and getting Marki for Two. At $37, the dinner is such a bargain for two, with 4 rolls and 2 soups or salads. My jaw nearly dropped to the floor when I realized how much food we were snagging.   The weekly lunch special is also a deal. You can get 2 or 3 rolls, with a soup or salad, for under $20. With these prices, you'd expect to be eating Giant Eagle sushi, but it's certainly several levels above that. The fish is fresh, and while the standard rolls can be a little "blah", the specialty rolls are fantastic. I lean towards spicy or crunchy rolls, and was satisfied with my choices. The spicy isn't too spicy, and the crunchy isn't overwhelming.  Ginza is also BYOB, making it a great casual dinner date spot. Considering the place is almost always empty, it'd probably make a great spot for a group dinner as well.   Judging by the proximity of Ginza to my front door, I know I will be back. There are certainly better sushi places in the city, but Ginza is close, affordable, and will always do the trick.

Qs9-PMJtcVjDzaORsF5bDg.text: This is my favorite sushi place in Pittsburgh. It's never busy and the food is great. I love the red tiger roll and the spicy girl roll. Also, if you get sashimi they give you HUGE pieces and sometimes give you three pieces instead of just two.   The service is great, and while I REALLY wish they delivered, they make take out really easy - they remember my name/order every time I call.

l-GR1i0RyKuovq7iYES1xw.text: More tests are needed, but I've been here at least twice, and never left disappointed. The service here is great - very attentive without being annoying. It is quite a small place though, so it's probably not hard.   If you're into salads... The Japanese ginger dressing is the s***. The iceberg lettuce you put it on is just meh. But the dressing - for real.   Miso soup. Pretty good. Opaque in color, and keeps you wondering what else is in there. I think for this reason it seems a little more substantial since it's not completely clear.   I've had the Ginza roll, which is freaking huge, and I also had to resist calling it the Yinza roll. I think it's about 12 pieces. It's got tuna, salmon, yellowtail, and Kani for the meats and among other things some delicious spicy mayo.   Besides sushi, they also have a nice selection of other rice, noodle, and hibachi dishes.   It is BYOB and I hit myself on the forehead every time I forget this before going.  My favorite thing is the cute little orange they give you at the end. It's the perfect ending.

qQ9IZI5TrODDsU8bF7cOMQ.text: A hidden gem in Bloomfield! There aren't a ton of places in Pittsburgh that offer great specialty rolls, but this place was amazing. We ordered the maki for two, in which you get two regular maki rolls and two specialty rolls, as well as two soup or salads, all for only $37. Everything was delicious. Definitely will be coming back to try the other rolls, as well as the hibachi.

ys7FTicVnZ0VQQ3OUP8rqg.text: Went here a while ago with Sarah S. Most of the sushi was pretty good. Like Rachel C., we got the 4 roll deal, and it was a steal for the price. Everything was super pretty and even came with blinking light up thingys on the plate.  That being said, the lobster was pretty bad :( pretty bad like I bit into it and wanted to spit it back out, but made myself chew and swallow it. It kind of ruined my experience.  So, sushi good, lobster bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi!

dIFhAjhx4dwd38N6NLMVHA.text: So so delicious, and they actually had toro and new style sashimi appetizers which in Pittsburgh, to my knowledge, only Umi has!!! The waiter was very knowledgable and kind and its BYOB whats not to love!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Toro sashimi, spicy scallop roll and samurai roll all amazing
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yellowtail jalapeño app and salmon miso app. So good!!!

ORbJnhGcvblQd10AsLeM_g.text: This is a cute little restaurant in a kinda hipster neighborhood near the city. Parking was a bit of a challenge and it's to be expected in these parts but after 3 laps around the block, we found a space.  Upon entering, we were greeted by a very friendly lady at the desk and seated in a location that was away from the door which was very thoughtful on her part.   The place was pretty empty with only one other table occupied by a gentleman reading a newspaper and eating sushi. This concerned me but I do trust my Yelp buddies as you guys have yet to let me down. After gazing over the menu a few times, I opted for sushi and my fellow diner chose the pan fried chicken udon.  It's kinda cool that this is really a hibachi spot without the popular shows...like Benihana or the other spot I will never mention (ahhh Ichiban choooo). Ichiban in the Waterworks/Fox Chapel area is horrible...can you tell I'm still mad at them? Sorry, not sorry.  Okay, back to Ginza...  The noodles came with a side of soup or salad. My fellow diner didn't care for their miso. It was originally thought the soup option would be the regular clear broth so the waiter happily offered to replace it. A few minutes later, however, the waiter returned with a salad. I wasn't sure how the waiter missed this with an empty restaurant. Although the salad dressing tasted more like thousand island with a bunch of mayo added, we decided not to complain because he was so very nice and hey...it's just salad anyway. Shortly after that, our selections arrived. The sushi was pretty good and the price was fair in my opinion. Tempura shrimp were cooked well and the fish tasted fresh. The udon was just okay but the chicken had that nice rich grilled taste.   While I probably wouldn't return here for a salad, soup or entree, I definately would come back for more sushi! (3 stars for sushi!)

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pan fried chicken udon

bny5rgMCfM3poRhXN6QIzw.text: Over the past year I've been traveling all through the Mid West and East Coast on grad school visits/auditions and tested sushi all along the way. Of course, one of the best places I found was right in my backyard, this is probably the best sushi in Pittsburgh. Which is always why I'm confused when I visit and the place is empty? Maybe I always catch odd hours? Maybe people do take out? Not sure, either way, I don't mind the chill environment. We regularly get the Maki for 2 which comes with soup or salad, we almost always end up taking about a full roll home, the servings are generous! The miso soup is super delicious and piping hot when it hits your table. The service for the sushi is always speedy and beautiful, we haven't had a roll that we disliked. The fish tastes clean and fresh while the tempura rolls are crispy and light. Definitely recommend this little spot!

6-1XDlcfGukAye7-78h9Vg.text: I love Ginza, its my go to sushi place in Pittsburgh. I think its the best sushi deal for the quality and quantity you get. The fish is good and fresh, granted its no Umi so don't expect that, but its a step up for sure from some comparable priced places (Sushi Too comes to mind, but I still order from there because they deliver). For the best deals on fresh fish, the sashimi appetizer is 10 pieces for $9. They also have a dinner for 2 special which is $40, comes with 2 soups or salads and you get to pick 2 special rolls (which are $11-15 each) and 2 regular rolls (also $6 each). If you do the math, its a great deal and you feel like a king when that much sushi is brought out to you. Generally, I ask for less sauce on my special rolls, I don't particularly like masking the fish flavor. Their tempura is also great, nice and crispy, and the appetizer is sizable.  Its BYOB if you are dining in, and the bulk of their business is takeout so there's never a wait for a table. Outdoor seating is available when the weather is nice, but Liberty Ave isn't the most pleasant view. If you're ordering takeout, give it 25-30 minutes for your order to be ready, sometimes 45 minutes if its peak takeout time. I do really wish they would deliver, I'd order more often!

9Y1WvIP-ckobPA3wPTFdpg.text: I recall watching the documentary film "Jiro Dreams of Sushi" (highly recommend for anyone wanting to learn a little more about sushi or about sushi master Jiro Ono himself) on Netflix a couple weeks ago and immediately realized that it had been months since I had some sushi.  The next day I purchased a LivingSocial deal for Ginza, and then the day after that my husband and I made dinner reservations and redeemed the deal.  The atmosphere was very relaxed, unpretentious.  Service was efficient and personable on a busy Friday evening, just the right mix of casual and professional.  There was a steady influx of new dine-in customers during the nearly 2 hours we spent at Ginza, a relatively small establishment, as well as a number of take-out customers who came and went.  The reason for our lengthy dinner was a large party that received all its orders ahead of us.  The server and manager handled the situation well though, apologizing for the busy sushi bar and bringing over a complimentarily heap of edamame to help pass the time.  Really loved the Ginza Roll and would order it again in a heartbeat.  Tuna Mountain was also very good, but next time--and there will be a next time--I think I'll pass on it in favor of a Rainbow Roll or a Dancing Eel.  I'm a big fan of eel rolls, and to be honest my terrific but eel-less dinner at Ginza still left me craving some eel.  The 2 simple rolls we chose as part of our "Marki for Two" order, a Yellowtail Roll and Boston Roll, were so-so; really simple rolls rarely wow me.  Western Pennsylvania obviously isn't exactly a sushi hot spot, but Ginza was satisfying indeed.  We were very pleased with our meal and the service here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ginza Roll, Tuna Mountain, Yellowtail Roll, &amp; Boston Roll
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Miso Soup &amp; Side Salad
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Out Front

eY3VNUOfOQiDtT_uaVBj0w.text: I love sushi, all kinds of sushi-as long as it's fresh. The miso soup was good. The futo maki and spicy girl rolls were good. The samurai, with seared scallops was not. The scallops were hardly seared and they were fishy. This is a standard Pittsburgh sushi roll restaurant. If you are looking for good sushi, eat elsewhere.

TYj8ZbVI8zrZD4gumAQbMg.text: We are sushi addicts who wanted to see what was available near West Penn hospital (we are from out of town) and Ginza showed up in our search. It was after 2 pm, awkward for lunch but early for dinner so lots of places aren't open, but Ginza was.  When we walked in, there was literally one other person eating, which made us a wee bit nervous, wondering about the sushi "turnover" and whether the fish was super fresh.  I need not have been concerned.  It was amazing.  We received attentive but not hovering service and our meals were delightful.  My daughter had two rolls which were delicious.  One in particular called a Handsome Boy Roll, and it was one of the best rolls either of us had ever had.  I had a tuna roll and many pieces of nigiri, including yellowtail belly and salmon belly, which aren't available on many sushi menus in the city.  I will definitely make it a point to eat here as often as possible.  I wish it had been more crowded just because it's that great, but hopefully it is more so at actual lunch and dinner times.  Additionally, there is one step up into the restaurant from the sidewalk.  I mention this because my daughter is on crutches although she's quite good at them by now.  The hostess appeared almost instantly at the door and asked if we needed assistance (we didn't) but that's when we saw a buzzer by the door that a person can ring if they need help getting into the restaurant.  That's the first one we've seen in the city and we go lots of places.  A very nice touch.

SSJNT_VD1h3ccsn8dFvlew.text: This is TRULY a hidden gem of Pittsburgh! I have lived in Pittsburgh for nine years, and this is definitely one of my top 3 favorite restaurants of Pittsburgh. My husband and I try to eat here at least once a month, and surprisingly it has also become one of his favorite restaurants of Pittsburgh.   Ginza is perfect for our Friday date night. The atmosphere is relaxed yet romantic, and the price is definitely right. It's BYOB. We are always shocked by how few people know about this little treasure. We have never had to wait to find a seat on a Friday evening.   My husband is not a sushi or sashimi fan, but I am. We both seem to find an entree that suites us. My husband is very much a "meat and potato" kind of guy, so what a God sent it was for him to actually ENJOY food at a nice Japanese restaurant. My favorite sushi treat is the Lobster Tempura roll. My husband consistently orders the Shrimp Hibachi. We are both obsessed with the Yum Yum sauce that comes with it. We share the red bean mochi and green tea mochi for dessert, and the consistency of the shell is always perfect.    Only one con: parking is difficult in the area. You may need to circle around some side streets to find some on-street parking.  I highly recommend Ginza, and we hope more people will discover this wonderful restaurant gem of Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Tempura Roll

iDGvje-N4fMZboVT_mrkSw.text: I hesitate to tell people that this gem exists, but in fear of them closing because of lack of food culture, I feel so obligated to share the love.  People.... $8 at lunch buys you TWO sushi rolls and a salad or soup.   It's healthy!! It's fresh!! It's delicious! If you don't like the salt taste of your sushi then order it with soy paper for gods sake. Time to shed those pasta pounds Bloomfield.  GINZA IS AMAZING. LA sushi snob for 8 years, moving here you realize good sushi is farrrrr and few between.  This is the real deal.  Get some.

4XwFD-wjCDZHzB6HfpH0mw.text: We had the ginza roll, octopus sashimi, and shrimp sushi. The sushi was good and fresh. The service was also nice and it was relatively fast. It was not very busy, but we were there on a Wednesday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ginza rills, octopus sashimi, and shrimp sushi

lWxzT2DizVmHkZfJ3zwiIg.text: Today my friend and I stopped by for lunch and were greeted by a very friendly waiter who was chatty and nice. After looking over the lunch menu we settled on ordering suchi (3 rolls for $11, great price) and an order of Beef Teriyaki which came with our choice of miso or salad. I ordered the miso and it was warm (not hot) and was nothing to write home about. When our sushi came out, it looked nice on the plate, but was nothing above and beyond. Regular, not so interesting or tasty, but okay. (Rolls were Spicy Salmon, Cucumber and Eel, and Avocado and Tuna). Next came the Beef Teriyaki. It arrived on the plate with some shredded carrot and rice, and the meat sat on top of cooked green pepper, celery and onion. It arrived slightly warm and without much taste.   The atmosphere is nice, the people are nice, but the food was just not very good or worth a return trip.

KPWdPDC2-pIkEvbYiElcoA.text: My favorite sushi in the city. It's always made perfectly and presented very nicely. The Hibachi and some of the other options on the menu are all extremely good too, especially the calamari.

3k9QK6EaAh0nn1m4KbWAiQ.text: We ordered Tako Yaki, Lobster Tempura, and Chicken Hibachi. The takoyaki was a little too soft. The interesting thing about lobster tempura was the wrap was not dry seaweed. It was Sakura pink! Chicken Hibachi was good. I like the chicken taste.

8Sm8pIM-5J2WgUOeiO6r3A.text: On Wednesday, I ordered 4 rolls from then 10 mins before closing but they still made it really good and not even complained about I ordered it so late. Gun a is one of my favorite sushi places.

gDv98GTc0_iBKbhkw0_LpA.text: I just enjoyed a delicious meal of fresh sushi with my family. The service was friendly and accommodating. The Naruto roll is refreshing and healthy. I highly recommend Ginza.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-Fw6CXB-2cwSOxKJVtsRCw.text: The sevice came with a smile here. The server was incredibly friendly and made suggestions off of the menu as I had not been here before.

CcOUA7WRpjwgiEWVycjhAQ.text: The $21 sushi and sashimi combo for one was pretty good. The fish was fresh and the nigiri were well made. The california rolls were a bit sloppy -- but nobody cares about california rolls (it was flummoxing why they would put california rolls in the combo except to fill people up).  This place stands out as an oasis of decent sushi in this price range, in a city that is otherwise a sushi desert. The pricing is alright considering the landlocked nature of Pittsburgh and the lack of good competition.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi and sashimi for one.

Jtiyrifu3zKSaAeBREdmjA.text: I have finally found the Holy Grail of Sushi places.... Cheap... High Quality... Beautifully made and served... What more could one ask for?

LckfcXwxXJrK47Cd7obx7Q.text: Just changed ownership - didn't warn us about menu changes. Very uphappy

Cejun5TalLvonOum0Ta44A.text: I love this place I have been going there regularly whenever I am in the mood for good sushi!    Ginza is by far the best Sushi I have had in Pittsburgh!  Being that Pittsburgh has no ocean in sight it is amazing that the sushi here easily rivals sushi I have gotten in good sushi places in Boston, NY or SF.  The fish is quite fresh unlike many other sushi places in Pittsburgh!  Also the menu is the most extensive for sushi that I have seen in in this city if you are looking for more then a California or tuna roll.   I think this place is relatively new because they don't have their liquor license yet so it is BYOB (ie. bring your own sake or Sapporo or whatever your beverage of choice is with sushi!)  ... and try the Guava candy on your way out.. it is good too :-)

CMKq8rSDCUtLvvxC_xs1zQ.text: Decent option for sushi. I prefer Chaya, but the mountain for two here is not bad at all.

Yio4kjW53TWsnxZjAgO12Q.text: I just found Ginza, and my hubby and I ate there today. Best sushi I've had in years!! The server was also really friendly, and the restaurant was really nice. We will be going back!

nIL0GbDCEhTivZmqxmFM1g.text: I was cautious about trying this restaurant - I'm very picky about sushi and generally try out a couple rolls before attempting sushi/sashimi.  On our first visit, I had their lunch special - 3 rolls and a salad.  I had the eel cucumber, a tuna and a salmon roll.  All of them were quite acceptable and the stage was set for a 'real' visit.  I finally dragged the husband there late one night when we didn't feel like driving somewhere.  He had the hibachi chicken, which came with big piles of rice and veggies as well as chicken.  I had a tuna roll, salmon sashimi, special white tuna sushi and unagi sushi.  Other than the weird presentation of the sashimi (wrapped around cucumber like you'd get in a cucumber roll) - everything tasted good and was quite fresh.  I actually wanted more of the special white tuna, but restrained myself.

smrELLZfBOUdB7YjdpviWA.text: Went here for the first time tonight, the food was very average at a good price -- you can get better food nearby.  Decor and atmosphere was nothing spectacular.  While the service was good we called to ask if there was a bar before arrival and were told this place was BYOB,    We brought a mini cooler with some beer.  There was no corking or bottle opening required on their part and no corking fee advertised on the menu.  We simply asked for two empty glasses, opened our own beer, poured it ourselves and were charged a $3 corking fee PER PERSON for requesting empty glasses.    If we had brought a bottle of wine, they opened it, brought a bucket of ice or gave some sort of "corking" service, this would have been completely acceptable.  BYOB and requesting empty glasses is not a "corking" service and we could have went somewhere within the same block and ordered the beer for $3 per person.  Go to Nikki's Thai Kitchen or somewhere else, this place is not worth the time.  One positive note, the dishes were very well presented.

RS4oWRLJH-G498nyxy_y5w.text: We were searching for some good, inexpensive sushi around the area in Pittsburgh, and Ginza seems to meet those conditions. Fairly inexpensive, good ratio of rice/stuff inside the rolls. Our only complaint is that the miso soup was a bit bland (but not bad), and the shrimp tempura roll was a bit greasy.

r3lH4GIOmnkdYe8XPCTYyg.text: Really great chicken katsu. Tasty sushi--better than most places in Pittsburgh, for sure.  Friendly staff (if occasionally a little awkward!).  Lovely ambiance, quiet and calm.  Prompt service.  I've got pretty much no complaints.  And the portion sizes are respectable, for a very good price!  I expect that the price will go up and the portion sizes down, within the  next few months--it's just too good.

sm4ZFhzCF_Et6T7yCRYZog.text: This place was great. Family went last night for dinner great japanese food with good presentation. I had the pork dumplings and wife had veg spring rolls. Main for me soup style chicken with vegetables and wifey had the amazing chicken, did not disappoint. Excellant food and good service will be going back.

DBmq7m0pNyg_2GcEIXZZhg.text: Sushi is wonderful, prices reasonable, service is Very good-natured. BYOB was nice. Pad Thai OK, but the texture of the shrimp a little chewy.

MDlivrjUuwkjVzThM5WPww.text: Yum. The menu online was limited but when I sat down it took forever for me to decide what to get. I ordered the "Amazing Chicken" and was indeed amazed. Pretty much your standard sweet & sour chicken with chunks of fresh pineapple which was a nice touch, but tasted phenomenal. Came with a side of fried rice and miso soup and salad. Soup was OK, could have had a little more kick and the salad was not the best because the lettuce was really watery. However, the main portion was an A+. Can't wait to go back.

SpzyzXAnBBclujSCooMydQ.text: Our server was excellent ! Food was  presented well, tasty and filling.How ever smaller portions than previous owners and no sweet carrots ;(

22CaJ4BY7GVq_8J9KxXBWA.text: Outstanding menu, pricing, and service. We had a LivingSocial $15 for $30 coupon, so that was naturally great. Awesome BYOB. They were kind enough to move us, mid-meal, to the table outside that had been previously occupied so that we could enjoy the weather. They have a $38 special for 2 featuring 2 standard rolls (we did spicy tuna and spicy scallop), 2 special rolls (the waitress suggested Angry Dragon and Ginza, which both kicked ass), and either a miso soup or house salad to start for each. Can't say enough good things about these guys!

Ifzshe7qVo1M3k6PsowT9A.text: Finally a sushi place on liberty!  It used to be Hibachi Express but they remodeled and expanded their menu. It was an awesome place before and continues to be. Priced right with great food. I had a quick dinner with the chicken hibachi. For $10 I got enough food for 2 meals. It came with a salad, soup, container of fried rice, and a separate container of chicken and vegetables. No doubt in my mind this place is going to become a popular spot. Oh and it's BYOB. Give it a shot and you'll become a repeat customer like me.

IrLfXBnO0ZuvXD7XHAU0lA.text: We stumbled across this place during a stroll and it was just what we needed on a hot Pittsburgh night.  The sushi was good and reasonably priced.  The restaurant is in a good location and is clean and new.  The staff was nice and very attentive.  I look forward to going back soon!

k3dVnVe8duCpY52szwPPgg.text: Dinner was awesome and service was top notch. We had hibachi and sushi and they were both spot on.   Restaurant was clean and the atmosphere was pleasant.  Definitely coming back!

A6FS_aDbtglR4uGnXbY33g.text: I have now been back several times since my last review and the woman I wrote about above has been nothing but nice. They have also hired additional wait staff as well. The food, as always, continues to be incredible. No complaints!

IoBCY733QZCLq_m9DVGgPA.text: I had the Sushi Deluxe.  Which was a 9 piece of sushi and a tuna roll.  I asked for Eel and they added it in for me which was cool, since it wasn't part of the usual 9 pieces.  The sushi itself, though, was tiny.  Each piece was about half the size that you would get at a better sushi restaurant like Andys, Chaya, or Sushi Too.  For the same price I could've gotten twice the amount at a little better quality.  The fish wasn't too great and two of the pieces were very chewy and kinda gross.  I like cheap sushi, but this isn't cheap enough to justify its poor taste.   I give it 2 stars due to the size of the rolls and the amount of food I got for 17 dollars.  I'm not too picky about my sushi, but really I'd rather spend the same somewhere better or less at a real cheap place like Sushi Boat in oakland.

wECn20tbOxZUoq9znm2nrw.text: Got the Maki for two for myself,   The food itself was pretty good. Nothing too special stood out to me, but the maki for two deal is unbeatable.   On the bright side, everything that was tempura in the rolls were still crispy which is a huge plus! Not warm, but crispy.   The server was nice, kind and considerate.  The reason I am docking two stars is because our food took 1.5 hours. For a dine in restaurant, this is unacceptable. We got edename while waiting, but never too much of a reason for the delay!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maki for two -good for one!

LzKX8Zr8uEUi9p3qUPUVfg.text: The sushi rolls taste very good, definitely try Zen roll. And the fat tuna sashimi is my favorite. Also recommend Salmon tartar as appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tIUJQ0MfaICadsajqJ_5DA.text: So good! Love this place and it's definitely in one of my All-Time Top 5 sushierias (made that up, feel free to use it ). I have not dined in for a very long time, but when I did, the BYOB aspect was great and the creative rolls were so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy yellowtail and Philly rolls with a seaweed salad and chops to go!

d29Kg9mm4oRm_bApfIcUXg.text: Kind of disappointed by my experience ordering from Ginza. Today was my first time at Ginza, and I ordered the lunch roll special to go plus an appetizer. I wanted to try this place given its good reviews, but was let down. I ordered the 3 roll lunch special (california roll, tuna roll, salmon avocado roll) which comes with a soup or salad, and also ordered an age-tofu as an appetizer. My overall bill came to around $17-18.  I order age tofu at every "Japanese" restaurant I go to because it is a litmus test that reveals whether the restaurant knows its craft. The age-tofu today revealed to me the unfortunate truth: that Ginza is not worth the hype and that they don't really know what real age-tofu is. The age-tofu that I received looked like deep fried pieces of medium-firm tofu (real age-tofu is made with extra silken tofu), served with a spring roll dipping sauce. Real age-tofu is served with a shoyu sauce, drizzled over the tofu thus masking the fried texture.  The rolls from my lunch special - california, tuna, and salmon/avocado - were decent. Better than supermarket sushi, but really nothing to praise. The rolls here are at about the same level of craft as the ones at Oishi Bento in Oakland.

X4QGkWUvtpLqBBKQX4Y8Tg.text: Hopped around town for a go-to for sushi and finally made time to try out Ginza.  My only regret is not coming sooner!  Ginza has good selection of fish and maki.  I tend to stay with simpler rolls and hand rolls - so to me, as long as quality is good..I'm happy.  My boyfriend loves the specialty rolls here.  For appetizers, we had the soup ($2) and calamari (very meaty!).  I like Ginza because it's good value for good sushi.  I will be back for more.

hv0cjuj6hH23wNy6cH7N9g.text: Unfortunately, the sushi and sashimi served here is not good enough to consider a return visit. Cold, bland, fishy and worse than from packaged boxes you might get in the supermarket or at a takeaway stand.  The miso soup was oddly sweet - not in a bad way, but notable.  Service was decent. Perhaps the cooked meals are better here, but if you're coming for raw fish and rice you may find yourself disappointed.

6ejnXrn2Gb3nT2fbOZPdwQ.text: This place had some great rolls and some okay rolls. Thy are also BYOB and no wait to get a table. Overall I was satisfied and full. LOVED the strong man roll because I love soft shell crab and spicy tuna put together! Pretty disappointed with the spicy tuna roll because as I love me some spicy tuna, this just wasn't spicy. I had to ask for sriracha on the side. Also the harumaki, which are their veg spring rolls, were delicious! I would come back to try different rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy tuna, angry dragon roll, strong man roll, and tuna mountain

JDlKdcSZSfHRGr27LIO_Ag.text: I ordered take-out from Ginza on a Sunday so I cannot speak to any aspect of eating in the restaurant. I walked in to order from the menu and the front staff told me it would be able 30 minutes. I returned 30 minutes later only to be asked to wait an additional 5-10 minutes. I decided to wait at one of their outdoor tables. After 20 minutes, I returned inside to ask if my food was done. It was not and the front desk staff explained that it was very busy and the kitchen was backed up. When all was said and done--it took about 60 minutes for my order to be ready.   That was a bad start. When I got home, I found the sushi to be fresh and tasty so that did redeem Ginza in my eyes. I enjoyed all three of the rolls I had ordered. I really liked the spicy sauce they use--its a bit spicier than other sushi restaurants which is preferable for me.

WdS-vax8zu1zxZpwhFQ49A.text: My go to for sushi  I love everything I've tried there so far, oh and it's BYOB! I always bring my out of town friends to Ginza if they're down for sushi. Good price, good atmosphere, good food, and good service. The only reason I didn't give a five stars is that they're kind of slow, but it really depends on the day. I went during the day once and they were fast. Anyway, my fav sushi place near me (:

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. sushi porn, basically.  Spicy tuna, spicy salmon, spicy cooked white fish, sweet potato roll, and fat tuna nigiri

iPaYXvxcIGoqlRNFuCrfBg.text: I've been here twice and the food and service have been consistently good both times.  Most recently we ordered the Maki for Two which comes with either salad or soup. The ginger dressing they use is really good so I wouldn't hesitate to get the salad. As for the Maki for Two, we went with salmon, tuna, Zen and Tiger rolls. Good portion sizes make this a pretty good deal, plus everything tasted really fresh. Living within walking distance is an added bonus but for the quality and value this place is also worth the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maki for Two: salmon, tuna, zen and tiger rolls

7ACkZRKfgW5ytSTOwVYXBg.text: Went for dinner, was very disappointed. The seafood soup was just water with soy sauce and some sad pieces of seafood and veggies, and it was super salty. The shrimp tempura was the worst tempura I've ever tasted, it was so greasy it looked like leftover food fried twice. Spicy tuna tasted nothing like tuna or spicy. Overall experience was bad.

ovsvNTV-tyw-4RLiPldf6A.text: This was my first time trying this place out for take-out. I called ahead for an order and when I arrived it was already waiting for me. The place was completely empty other than me walking in and the people working there. I'm pretty sure it was because it was snowing and no one wanted to venture out.   I ordered two salmon ngiri sushi, spicy salmon roll, dragon roll, and gyoza. I grabbed my order and checked it out in the car. It looked so delicious and it definitely was when I finally got to try it. I was really satisfied with the size and freshness of my ngiri salmon and the spicy but not deathly spicy salmon roll. It was on the smaller side and perfect. The gyoza came with six pieces and a good size container of soy sauce. Everything had soy sauce on the side and I like this because some places give you one small container for your entire order. Not here! My dragon roll was different than what I'm used to seeing and tasting from a dragon roll, but that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy it. Each piece was covered with avocado slices and fresh all around. So freakin' good!! I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gyoza
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dragon roll
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy salmon roll with salmon ngiri. Bomb!

i4F02Zgu-rTHf_TdTKSYHQ.text: This is a Japanese restaurant but I can't gat past the sushi long enough to order anything else. We had the Red Tiger Roll, which is one side shrimp and one side spicy salmon, a smaller spicy salmon roll (with crunchy), a smaller spider roll with lightly battered soft shell crab, and Cheese Chikuwa roll with baked cheese filled fish cakes in soy wrappers. Everything was very good. They have daily specials and it is BYOB so you can bring a nice bottle of wine. Bloomfield is Pittsburgh's "little Italy" so this was a surprise find but it is a gem.

A8MlcOR5pmxIVU-FpjW7Cw.text: I stopped at Ginza on a cold Friday night before a show. I was in the mood for some soup, so I figured I'd give this place a shot! It was pretty crowded when we walked in, but we were greeted right away and sat down. We didn't have much time so we glanced the menu quickly and ordered! I ordered the beef noodle soup and my girlfriend got Sushi. The broth was really tasty and all of the mixed veggies were delicious, but I wasn't a huge fan of the beef itself. It was a bit dry. Overall, we enjoyed the atmosphere and would definitely go back and try something else as their menu is huge!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef Noodle Soup

9sdOpu8DZnd3hqr37SINTw.text: Three days later and my neighbor is still texting me..." I loved that sushi." Our friend and neighbor joined the BF and I at Ginza for dinner and IT. WAS. GREAT. Now, it was late on a Thursday, so it was empty, which may explain the speedy service but not the fantastic sushi. That was all Ginza. They have quite a few options and we ordered way too much, but it was so, so good. We started with salad and the ginger dressing was not what I remembered but was very good. It seemed thicker than last time I had it, but it was great none the less. The BF and I went with the Maki for two which lets you pick rolls and soup/salad for each. We also got two for the table to split as an appetizer. I can't remember all the ones we ordered but I know we got one called a handsome boy and one called Godzilla. I was astounded when they brought it out. It was a large platter filled with sushi and for $37 you cannot beat it. I cannot tell you what was in any of them, but they were all fantastic. Our neighbor got a platter, but I have no idea what was on his. We all shared and I got lost what was on each platter. As a side note, and this is going to sound strange, but their water was the best water I have had in a restaurant in forever. I even said so, which made the table regard me as an idiot, but after a sip Todd was shocked at how good it was. It was so crisp and refreshing! Try it; you won't be disappointed.

lgrUklIQVz5f81l1C6nilw.text: I tried this place for the first time last night with a friend and had a great experience.  Although it was a Saturday night it wasn't too busy and we easily got a table.  They are open later for dinner until 11pm on weekends and we went around 10.  The servers were very attentive and friendly.  We started with the seaweed salad and tuna tartare and both were excellent.  Then we split the sashimi deluxe and 3 of the rolls.  The sashimi was very fresh and included some more rare options, such as sea bass and fluke.  We were also impressed with all of the rolls, which had generous pieces of fish. We had the samurai roll which was topped with scorched scallops, the dragon roll and a spicy yellowtail roll.  The prices were also very reasonable.  It's hard to find good quality affordable sushi in Pittsburgh, so that is why this is getting 5 stars.

cQwZk0nU3qP9qF4Sg6pVGQ.text: I had such a wonderful time at Ginza and I can't wait to go back! The food was great, our service was friendly and timely and the price was right. This might be my new favorite sushi place! Also, this place is a BYOB! Woo!  Our server, Bin, took wonderful care of our 6 person table. He was courteous and very attentive to us. My boyfriend and I went for the Maki for two, which was the perfect amount for us--Two special rolls and two regular rolls. Let's us each pick our favorites and have some to share! We went for the Strongman roll, Rainbow roll, spicy salmon and California roll. That menu selection also comes with two soups or salads. With two miso soups, an additional seaweed salad and the 4 rolls, we were very satisfied and full after our meal! Can't wait to go back for more.

XMvVRVznmeUhDSGBdLHHhQ.text: Comfortable and friendly restaurant with great sushi and service. They honored our reservation and sat us at a nice table. The waiter patiently gave menu recommendations and the food was delicious as well. I recommend the miso salmon if you're looking to try a dish that's a little different from your typical sushi. You will definitely enjoy Ginza!

di-EBQzIybqUr89DkDo4pw.text: We had to wait 1.5 hours for 4 sushi rolls. Clearly, take-out orders had been made a priority over the four tables dining-in. The waiters kept apologizing for the wait, but obviously weren't that sorry since no one did so much as remove a drink from the final bill.

AVdHZFY7ZsvBcDSQvarkkg.text: I'm branching out. it's truly unbelievable that I'd part from Penn Ave Fish Company. I mean, let's get real, I'll never stay away long but I've found a good option in Ginza. The truth is Ginza is cheaper and the rolls are larger. That's just it. Go big or go home.  So if you're craving good sushi at a great price with massive servings, this is your place! I really like that you can put together your own combinations with money saving prices. Between the two of us we split the Marki for Two for $33. It was two specialty rolls and two regular rolls. What a steal!  We ordered the Tuna Lover and Spicy Girl specialty rolls plus the tuna avocado and philly roll. On top of the rolls you also get soup and salad. I mean, geez. Keep piling on the food... and this was just for lunch! All the rolls were really fantastic, with the Tuna Lover being my favorite.   I can tell this is going to fit into the regular rotation of restaurants I'll frequent. I can't wait to come back and try the habachi meals too. Seriously, I could spend months ordering all the different menu options. Maybe I should just set up shop here for the winter. Not too bad for winter hibernation mode.

34_8kB15el941b__MylPRA.text: The service was not good neither was the food. Sushi is not supposed to have a "fishy" smell to it and I learned my lesson later on as I had food poisoning the following day. One of our rolls didn't have any fish in it. A friend I was dining with inspected hers too. When we complained, the owner or manager rudely stuck her finger into the food on the plate. She didn't just point or touch it, I thought she was going to flick it into our faces. I will never come back here again and I used to love this place. What a disappointment!

frFhU1DLKUFTxB8k8dOKHA.text: For $50 it was terrible. Sushi was not fresh and tasted off. Small things of spicy mayo are $1.00 a piece. Take your $50 to sushi Fuku in Oakland and get the same for half the price

-nx0wlGSvqZgMCat8TTVrw.text: We have been coming here for about 3 years and have had just about everything on the menu and it's always a fantastic meal.  Not only is the sushi fresh, but the other entrees have generous portions and taste delicious.  The staff here is fantastic and they are always helpful and pleasant.  Many people choose take-out from here and the take out is always timely and packed well for travel.  My hubby and I often order the Maki for Two, which gives you two (2) special rolls and two (2) regular rolls, plus soup or salad for each of us.  The Fried Rice dishes are always a hit as well as any of the Noodle dishes (which my hubby usually gets as the soup option).  One great thing about the Noodle dishes are that they will customize your heat level.  Hubby loves spicy foods and they not only kick up the heat in making the dish for him, but will also provide additional heat additions for him to use at the table.  It is definitely our "Go To" spot for sushi and Japanese food.  The interior is always clean and although it's small, there always seems to be a place to sit (which probably comes from all the take-out they do).    Pros: Great food Sushi is fresh Prices are very reasonable Staff is extremely helpful Clean (which is super important to me)  Cons: Street parking (but it's Bloomfield so it's expected)  Overall, we are faithful customers and will continue to be.

r0Ay7jBRh16Graa6E3i8UA.text: Great place! I had the Angry Dragon Roll and my husband had the Spider Roll. We both really enjoyed our selections. I haven't had sushi this great in a long time. Not to mention, the service was fantastic. Super friendly and inviting! We'll definitely return next year during our annual trip.

imlN99-n5az686ZzJvVuuw.text: Stopped here before getting a tattoo nearby. Restaurant is clean and nice inside. We were immediately seated and their was only one other couple inside at the time.   I ordered the Ginza Roll and my date ordered Cali rolls with a side of spicy mayo. Both came out great. I absolutely loved the Ginza rolls!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ginza Rolls and Cali Rolls with a side of spicy mayo

A3ZwYXibFjZsb4_oGrWYfw.text: A solid sushi option. Highlights include reliability, fresh fish, friendly service, and plenty of room. Street parking. BYOB. My go-to family sushi restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. sashimi deluxe #haveagoodone
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sashimi Deluxe

zciB4GZDuVsR7QsqXUQg6w.text: The service was great the food was not. Tempur Shrimp was actually just panko breaded, and greasy. The takoyaki had no mayo and no bento flakes when I asked the waiter if they chould add it, but no one new the real takoyaki comes with mayo and bento flakes on top. Also the center was completely raw batter. Sushi was ok at best. Overall I was not impressed.

HquL5D99tBD7YfDTgebWEg.text: Visited Ginza after visiting the Pittsburgh zoo. Average sushi...wouldn't go out of the way to eat again but did have a nice selection of "rare" sashimi.

vnzOTnVBADojADt-e_LAcg.text: This place is a hidden gem.  They are somewhere between Japanese fast/takeout and a regular restaurant.  Better than most takeout for sure.  Their hibachi dinner boxes are solid, as is their sushi.   The place is unpretentious and fast.  If I had one complaint, it'd that I am always unclear on what menu items are not housemade.   I assume most of the appetizers are frozen but I never know what to get.   These side dishes are never very good.   Their prices on everything except sushi is a little more than it should be for what this is.  Not a big deal, though.

1gq2WJO4OreQawKDhNMHag.text: Omg!! This place is so good. Whenever I visit my boyfriend at Pitt we always come here! The sushi is not only fresh, but also delicious. The pieces are so big so it's not like you have to order 5 rolls! My fav

Q2Xt3tjCubYxfNxBIwhOXw.text: Meh, not that different from every other sushi place.   There really isn't much to say other than it's affordable and there's a decent spread of sushi/asian platters.

--2DVbraypo43Yl1g5I6xw.text: First visit and I'm not at all disappointed. I can't tell you how many times I walk by and just take for granted that it's there. "I'll get there sometime" kind of attitude. Jeez, I'm mad it took me so long. Sushi is just amazing and super fresh. And oh so affordable! Can't wait to get back!

Q_MWUlQ2fvQ9jsTML02nEg.text: Delicious sushi and great portions, plus they are BYOB!  Three dollars for a wine bucket and wineglass and a buck for a beer opener and we were in business.     We sampled the tempura oysters, four special rolls, and some eel sushi.   Way too much food for the two of us, but it was all tasty.  The oysters were the take it or leave it dish for me, but the sushi and maki stood up.   Next time, I would do the maki for two, which gets you two special rolls and two regular rolls for $37.95.   The portions are large, so half of that would be enough for me.     The server was prompt and friendly and there was no wait for a table on a Friday night.   A winner and we will be back.

s__YIQkqiPWHY-x_9NjdzQ.text: I took my 13 year old sushi freak nephew there today and he loved it. Really good sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The kid ate lots of sushi. Grandma approved.

xmAO8ACG18zfvPnDQOtqkQ.text: I did not find their sushi and sashimi fresh. I would not return. Price is comparable to other sushi restaurants in the city - not expensive but not worth the price.

8AIha-ZGYeon0v_9YubVSQ.text: Best sushi in the neighborhood for sure! If you're splitting with someone definitely get the "Maki for Two."

Ni7bbGRmeEMGuQ0HfGYcwA.text: I was there for lunch, 6 people total. Very fresh sushi with a superb lunch special. Service is friendly and attentive. The sushi is not complex but is reasonably priced and fresh.

gGhF1cOpiBhua0iyEgms7w.text: Went for a weekday lunch. Their bento boxes were flavorful and the sushi rolls had a variety of options in their 3 for $11 special. Friendly staff. I would select something other than the mango shrimp bento option next time but felt like trying something new.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pMOUhMpswcxgzuMYsjS9ow.text: I am a big fan of this place the sushi is great and the owner is always really nice to us.. We are doing often the lunch menu really good deal.. The only criticism is that some rolls are a little expensive

jrmyr1rw9STWeRiW7X3Ucw.text: Went here last night for the first time. It's BYOB and we brought two bottles of wine. The waitstaff is extremely friendly and the service is just the right pace. Not too fast, not too slow. The atmosphere is nice and relaxed. TV for those who want to watch the game.   I ordered the edamame for an appetizer. It was good, but not great. May have been a little older than I would've liked. The sushi was very reasonably priced. The fish was fresh and delicious! The pretty girl roll was my favorite. Sweet potato roll was an interesting one too! See mt picture for the whole plate! Can't wait to go back to Ginza.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretty girl, Naturo, spicy tuna, sweet potatoes and avocado and salmon.

GOMhGiJOw3Ly5NSpWg-MHw.text: We stopped here for the lunch special on a Tuesday.  They have a really flexible sushi roll lunch special - you can choose 2 or 3 rolls from an extensive list and it comes with either miso soup or a salad. The miso soup was particularly good and both of my daughters, who are often hit-or-miss about miso, really liked it.   The sushi was great - fresh and meaty.  My husband got some fancier rolls and we were impressed by the flavor combinations. We will definitely be back to try more rolls, hopefully soon!

oL36b73l_tags30uYaEMBg.text: We got a few different rolls and wine for the table. There is a $3 BYOB charge for the whole table, regardless of how many people are there. I thought the sushi was a bit over priced, some rolls got up to $15 which is pretty steep. The rolls were all very tasty but it is definitely not a cheaper sushi place. Our waitress talked very quietly and it was sometimes hard to hear what she was saying. I think she may have been newer so we didn't mind too much.   My friend got the teriyaki sauce with her hibachi but she said it tasted pretty average.  overall i liked Yokoso at the Waterfront area better so i'm unsure if i'd come back but it was still a good experience!

ZFrAaskkUTLl4BorZw9PoA.text: We were near west penn hospital and wanted something besides hospital food but that was closed enough to the hospital. Ginza was one of the options so as a good yelper, I had to follow people's reviews. We came here on a Saturday during lunch which there were a couple of people enjoying their meals. We were seated immediately and realized that they had a reasonable lunch menu. We ordered the bento boxes which comes with soup/salad, rice, california rolls, siu mai and your main dish. As a healthy option, I got the steamed chicken with vegetables which comes with a savory sauce on the side. We also got the tofu bento box. The tofu was fried and delicious! It came with a sweet sauce (duck sauce maybe?). The food was good and it will definitely fill you up. Sooo... it's a great spot to try for sushi or bento boxes!

ZQV8i7NNE-_iQCFT-gusvA.text: Take-Review: I absolutely love this place. The actual restaurant is not that exciting inside, so I usually order take-out on my way home. This has officially become the take-out of choice when my parents are visiting from out of town as well. We always order 6-8 rolls and it comes so perfectly  presented even for it being packed to bring home. I absolutely love the Red Tiger roll, you get spicy salmon and shrimp tempura all in one roll. It's like getting two rolls in one which makes the price completely reasonable and worth it. Every specialty roll we've tried is great and they also do a great job with the traditional rolls if you are looking to keep it simple.   If you have someone in your group like my dad, that is still working on the "raw fish" concept, they have both Teriyaki entree options and hibachi dinners.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

urgawdHXVL30-3JAiIMKcA.text: I love Ginza! I usually order take out because, hello Netflix and chill, but my fiance and I had a date night here a couple weeks ago! We came in on a Saturday evening around 8, and the cozy little restaurant had some people already there, but we were able to get seated right away. Our waitress was very attentive, but not over bearing. We ordered edamame as an app and then we eat for a couple of sushi rolls for dinner.   Everything came out pretty quickly and tasted very fresh. They had so many roll options, it was hard to narrow it down... but that's definitely a good dilemma to have.   I told myself I have to dine in here more often because it was a great experience.   P.s. - takeout is effortless too. My food has always been ready for the time they said it would. Parking in that part of Bloomfield isn't terrible either, especially in the evenings!

cUnhhnayXhWIrHBvO-v7eQ.text: Great sushi.  And great value for the price.  We ordered 3 specialty rolls. The angry dragon, the kamikaze and a roll w eel.  All were ample and delicious.  The kamikaze was the best. Had some heat. I highly recommend it.  We also got the chicken teriyaki skewers.  I forget what it was called.  It was good but not amazing or anything.  The atmosphere was typical.  Plain and simple.  Service was attentive and friendly.   This will become a repeat spot.

p5nQdq0Lhj5gNru5IqT3Sg.text: Have eaten here twice, both times the sushi and rolls were good.  But for the price, I'm a bigger fan of Umami in Lawrenceville. It's just a step above in terms of quality, presentation...and then there are those amazing cocktails.... Still, if you're looking for decent sushi/rolls, nice atmosphere and good service in Bloomfield, Ginza is worth a stop.

The customer service was great too! I think this is a great spot to hit for a variety of specialty rolls. They also have other bento boxes and noodles on their menu. I look forward to coming back to try them!

f-rRSVkFEUndIZm0hGr9Tw.text: Ordered sushi to-go from here and was really pleased! I ordered the avocado roll and the sweet potato tempura rolls. The sweet potato tempura roll is quite large and each piece is definitely a mouth full. The avocado roll was very delicious and fresh. The rolls came with plenty of ginger, wasabi and soy sauce and were priced fairly. I will be back when I have another sushi craving!

9GwWxMXteZSrlEiA1xP1RQ.text: Tried Ginza for the first time yesterday with Alyssa and Noah. I was impressed! The vegetable sushi was excellent. I appreciated the traditional array of Japanese vegetables. Noah's Beef Teriyaki looked like very high quality meat.  We will be regulars from now on.

ysOAe9IiyTaNp2XBnWIa_A.text: Friendly service and great sushi. Food came out fast and tasted fresh. The server was on top of things. Found out the hard way it's BYOB, SO next time I'll just plan ahead and bring a 6-pack. Would definitely go back for more of the spicy tuna.

5C6iGTW8tvGVnHrzPunSDg.text: Seriously my favorite place to get sushi in the city! It is well priced, and the size of the sushi pieces is just perfect. I get upset when one buys expensive sushi only to find that the rolls are absolutely tiny.   The restaurant itself is never incredibly busy, I think a lot of people decide to take-out. The dining area is clean and sleek. The owner is usually the one who greets you; she is very friendly and will recognize after only a few times of coming in.   I usually get the avocado roll and the sweet potato tempura roll. The sweet potato one is actually a bit bigger than the normal rolls and it has a special sauce drizzled over it. It is good with or without soy sauce. Order at lunch and you get a soup or salad. I love the dressing for the salad! The lettuce leaves a little to be desired.   Good food. Not much else to say! When I'm in the sushi mood, this is definitely the place I go to.

I've eaten inside multiple times(awesome cause BYOB) and I've also done carry-out; both are great.  They have a great lunch special where you can get 3 rolls for $11.  Overall, Pittsburgh isn't a great sushi city but this place is one of the better spots and you'll always leave satisfied.

AruQyjj5KQWz2WXmSbpDLA.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant by accident. This place is awesome!!!! The food is the best Japanese food I have ever had. I have lived in NYC and Philadelphia s d this rates up with the big cities.  I highly recommend this restaurant and the pan fried udon.

pPsePhtZswc8kOK_ibbSkA.text: I've been going to this place for years, but I'll tell ya... I've gone weekly over the last month bc their sushi has been particularly delicious lately! Idk what they have changed, but this sushi just melts in ur mouth!! Fan-fucking-tastic!!

os_Ya_jYrqIp-06FYJFttQ.text: Absolutely loved the crazy Salmon roll and the Angry Dragon  Very nice staff, very patient and accommodating

eSIHHT_B3F5W8ghe0PX2pg.text: Hello. My name is Christy and I am a sushi-holic.  It has been 2 weeks since my last sushi meal...  I was looking for a place to satiate my craving after visiting a friend at West Penn Hospital.  Of course I pulled up Yelp and to my surprise, Ginza was barely a two block walk away!  The photos looked tasty and my dining companion and I were able to go in and get a table right away.  The waitress was pleasant and everything from our order came out SO fast.  We started with the clear soup which was very similar to the mushroom soup I love at Silk Road, except Ginza uses a darker broth.  It was delicious and the perfect thing to warm me up on a frigid February evening.    For our sushi selections, we had a California roll (I can never pass these up!), Aloha roll (yellowtail and jalapeno topped with spicy tuna), Naruto roll (tuna and salmon wrapped in cucumber, no rice!), and salmon sashimi.  I kid you not, our food came out probably less than 10 minutes after we ordered.  It was all fantastic and I really enjoyed the Aloha roll.    I don't get over this way too often, but I'm glad to have found another yummy sushi spot for when I get that hankering... it happens more often than I should probably admit!  I did notice a BYOB sign in the front window, so that seems like as good of an excuse as ever for me to get back here soon.

Moving from philly with dozens of decent to good sushi places this was pretty sad to hear. WfCoQKNhXGYgIKfcN7-SGg.text: Ginza is easily the single best bang for your buck restaurant in the city.  Great food at an even greater price, and the people who work are always incredibly friendly.   It's also BYOB, which is always a plus.  I'm very happy to have found this place.

wZgPZgtWh08CcFpr8M74eQ.text: Ginza serves a good variety of sushi and sashimi in a setting that is somewhat upscale but still comfortable enough for one to go there for a causal dinner. Most of the sushi is good. Not amazing, but the regular rolls are solid and some of the specialty rolls are very good. My personal favorite is the Greenwich roll. Prices are reasonable, even by Pittsburgh standards, and the restaurant is BYOB.   The service was a little rocky when the restaurant opened, but it has steadily improved since then and now is good. I wouldn't celebrate my wedding  anniversary there, but it seems like a good place to go with friends or your partner for sushi.

InFiW8g0mo70yrZ5ai8ZkA.text: I love this place. They are friendly, the atmosphere is comfortable. it is BYOB. the food is delicious and very reasonably priced. I get take out lunch from here at least once a week. they have a ton of vegan friendly options and never get the order wrong. such a go to and so glad it is in the neighborhood.

JFyOxuaA9IAYGpLwvjFqvQ.text: Stumbled upon this place one date-night and I was pleasently surprised. The BYOB was deffiantly a great perk as we stopped by the liquor store and picked up our favorite white.    We ordered a kani salad and the tartar to start. The kani salad was not as traditional as we are used to but good non the less. Now the tartar was probably one of the best tartars I have ever had. It came with some ponzu/yuzu dipping sauce and cucumbers to scoop it up with. Deffiantly delicious.     Now for the rolls. We ordered 4 rolls. 2 traditional (spicy tuna and salmon) and 2 of their specialty rolls. All were very good and larger in size than I am typically used to. Fatter if you will.     Food quality and taste ranked high for us. Price was a little higher than most Pittsburgers would be used to. But with what you save on the alcohol and the quality of fish it is worth it. (1 soup, 1 salad, 1 tartar, 2 traditional rolls, and 2 specialty rolls came to $67)    Only sort of downfall was the ambiance. We were one of only two tables in there. Probably wouldve felt a little more comfortable if it was a little noisier or busier. However, we will deffiantly be back soon!

eNdGHuP-W8CfpCriSI__iw.text: The sushi and sashimi here is very fresh and of high quality. There is a large selection of specialty rolls on the menu, which are my favorite items to order, and each roll is unique and delicious. The presentation of the sushi also never disappoints. The menu is very reasonably priced for the amount of food you receive. I have been here countless times and I always leave very happy with my dining experience. I highly recommend this restaurant as it is one of my favorite sushi spots in the city.

lILhsmdmMNAJ8jM8hlO1rg.text: This is my boyfriend and I's go-to sushi place. Parking is easy, service is friendly and their sushi is yummy.

vPKJIaGxR6cyeu6ll6IZVw.text: I like this place. The prices are fine. Clean, friendly and roomy. The only thing I don't like is they seem to not have air conditioning.

ZFZZTFL50UlRJsBPZX5AVQ.text: Very good soups, sushi, seaweed salads, and desserts.  Top quality sushi for very fair prices. By far the best deal you'll ever find in the city.
